item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 7, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:

2. Using Ghidra and Python to reverse engineer Ecco the Dolphin (255 points | 60 comments)
3. AI for real-time fusion plasma behavior prediction and manipulation (167 points | 86 comments)
4. QNX is now free for anything non-commercial, plus there's an RPi image (251 points | 101 comments)
5. Sustainable Web Interest Group Is Formed (31 points | 8 comments)
6. Show HN: BemiDB – Postgres read replica optimized for analytics (94 points | 39 comments)
7. Mushroom Color Atlas (98 points | 13 comments)
8. Edge Scripting: Build and run applications at the edge (33 points | 21 comments)

12. Passport Photos (1429 points | 209 comments)

22. Optery (YC W22) Is Hiring Product Managers and Full Stack Developer (Node.js) ( | hide)
23. Richard A. Cash, who saved millions from dehydration, has died (131 points | 36 comments)
24. Bluesky's at Protocol: Pros and Cons for Developers (16 points | discuss)
25. A blind but elusive critter that was presumed extinct is rediscovered (22 points | 5 comments)
26. DNA from Pompeii Victims Reveals Surprising Relationships Amidst the Chaos (19 points | discuss)
27. Gardens reduce seasonal hunger gaps for farmland pollinators (26 points | discuss)
28. Automat (187 points | 68 comments)
29. URAvatar: Universal Relightable Gaussian Codec Avatars (88 points | 12 comments)
30. Ask HN: Why did consumer 3D printing take so long to be invented? (34 points | 80 comments)
